intro: Parietaria guineensis, commonly known as African wall lettuce, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found growing on rocky or disturbed soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
